I do not have the ability to recommend a specific therapist. however, there are several ways to find a therapist who specializes in narrative therapy for trauma:

1. search online: you can search for therapists in your area who specialize in narrative therapy for trauma. many therapists have websites that describe their approach and areas of expertise. you can also use online directories, such as psychology today or goodtherapy, to find therapists in your area who specialize in this approach.

2. ask for referrals: you can ask your primary care physician, friends or family members who have attended therapy in the past, or local support groups if they know of any therapists who specialize in this approach.

3. contact a narrative therapy organization: the dulwich centre, a renowned narrative therapy center, is based in adelaide, australia, and you can contact them for information on narrative therapy as well as a list of narrative therapists in your area.

when you find a therapist who specializes in narrative therapy for trauma, it is important to schedule an initial consultation to discuss their approach and make sure that you feel comfortable working with them.
